meanings.definition: Able to be qualified or eligible.
meanings.sent1: The job applicant was qualifiable for the position because of his experience.
meanings.sent2: She had the necessary skills to be qualifiable for the scholarship.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was qualifiable to enter the dog show, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His determination made him qualifiable for success in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors made the painting qualifiable for the art exhibition.

meanings.definition: Capable of meeting the necessary requirements.
meanings.sent1: The team was qualifiable for the playoffs after winning the last game.
meanings.sent2: The student's hard work made her qualifiable for the advanced class.
meanings.sent3: The robot believed it was qualifiable to join the human dance competition.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking made her qualifiable for leadership roles.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy bridge was qualifiable for heavy traffic.
